f128c256-15b2-4dd6-9d2b-03481246a4f2.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an advanced level in food preparation. They are proficient in food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition, supervisory management, beverage management and cost control management and prepare food of the highest quality.
f128c256-15b2-4dd6-9d2b-03481246a4f2.name: ACF Certified Executive Chef® (CEC®)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of five years of work experience as a Chef de Cuisine, Executive Sous Chef, Pastry Chef, or chef in charge in a foodservice operation, supervising at least five full-time people in the preparation and production of food. Work history must be current within the last 10 years.

Must show the equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts through combination of education and work experience and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition, Cost Control Management, Beverage Management and Supervisory Management.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

02112327-c3f7-4f70-99cc-a1a88807dd8e.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an entry level in food preparation. They have a basic understanding in food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition and supervisory management and prepare food to standards.
02112327-c3f7-4f70-99cc-a1a88807dd8e.name: ACF Certified Culinarian® (CC®)

badge_template_activities.title: Two years entry-level work experience or equivalent education requirement. Work history must be current within the last 10 years.

Must show equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts through a combination of education and work experience and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition and Supervisory Management.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

a1f9af5e-6fba-4485-9311-2330935bbb36.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an advanced level in food preparation and as a culinary educator. They are proficient in food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition and education development and prepare food of the highest quality.
a1f9af5e-6fba-4485-9311-2330935bbb36.name: ACF Certified Culinary Educator® (CCE®)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of two years of work experience as a Chef de Cuisine or Working Pastry Chef, supervising at least two full-time people in the preparation of food and 1,200 teaching contact hours. Industry work history and teaching hours must be current within the last 10 years.

Must have Associate's degree in Culinary Arts OR a Bachelor's degree in any discipline and complete 120 hours of Education Development and 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition and Supervisory Management.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency AND classroom video demonstration to assess teaching skills.

8b44fcd7-5066-4a3e-8dcf-f49a3c9e5647.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an advanced level in food preparation with fiscal responsibility over foodservice operations. They are proficient in food safety, advanced sanitation, culinary nutrition, supervisory management, and human resource management and prepare food of the highest quality.
8b44fcd7-5066-4a3e-8dcf-f49a3c9e5647.name: ACF Certified Culinary Administrator ® (CCA®)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of three years of work experience as an Executive Chef with fiscal responsibility over food service operations and have supervised at least three full-time people. Work history must be current within the last 10 years.

Must show the equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts through combination of education and work experience and completion of 30 hours each in Nutrition, Food Safety and Sanitation, Supervisory Management, Advanced Sanitation, Human Resource Management. Must be certified at CCC, CEC, or CEPC level.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND written narrative to assess administrative and fiscal responsibilities.

fd29f0d5-63a5-420d-a3a5-632deccb5b61.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an intermediate level in food preparation. They have a good understanding in food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition and supervisory management and prepare food to high standards.
fd29f0d5-63a5-420d-a3a5-632deccb5b61.name: ACF Certified Sous Chef® (CSC®)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of two years of work experience supervising a shift or food station. Work history must be current within the last 10 years.

Must show equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts through a combination of education and work experience and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition and Supervisory Management.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

4fd115e7-9092-41e6-b6a8-6fa0d5a5dd3a.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an intermediate level in food preparation. They have a good understanding in food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition and supervisory management and prepare food to high standards.
4fd115e7-9092-41e6-b6a8-6fa0d5a5dd3a.name: ACF Certified Chef de Cuisine® (CCC®)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of three years work experience supervising a shift of food station and supervision of at least two full-time personnel in the preparation of food. Work history must be current within the last 10 years.

Must show equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts through a combination of education and work experience and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition and Supervisory Management.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

145928fb-3cc9-4577-a057-c9487eed16c5.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an entry level in pastry food preparation. They have a basic understanding in food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition and supervisory management and prepare food to high standards.
145928fb-3cc9-4577-a057-c9487eed16c5.name: ACF Certified Pastry Culinarian® (CPC®)

badge_template_activities.title: Two years entry-level work experience or equivalent education requirement. Work history must be current within the last 10 years.

Must show equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts through a combination of education and work experience and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition and Supervisory Management.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

e8ccddbb-5b97-46d7-94dc-a9d656cb2566.description: Earners of this badge have the knowledge to develop and implement safety and sanitation protocols to help minimize the risk of COVID-19 for both guests and staff.
e8ccddbb-5b97-46d7-94dc-a9d656cb2566.name: ACF COVID-19 Safety Trained

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of ACF COVID-19 Safety and Sanitation Training for Foodservice. The course covers key features of COVID-19, minimizing risk and preventing spread, best practices for the foodservice industry and examples from chefs in the industry.
Successful completion of written exam.

21170737-95a7-481a-a9a4-1c3f74bfa3da.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an advanced level in pastry food preparation. They are proficient in food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition, supervisory management, beverage management and cost control management and prepare food of the highest quality.
21170737-95a7-481a-a9a4-1c3f74bfa3da.name: ACF Certified Executive Pastry Chef® (CEPC®)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of five years of work experience as an Executive Pastry Chef, or chef in charge of food production in a foodservice operation, supervising people in the preparation and production of pastry food. Work history must be current within the last 10 years.

Must show the equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts/Baking Pastry through combination of education and work experience and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition, Cost Control Management, Beverage Management and Supervisory Management.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

0f1ed70b-ae65-4af2-a87f-9bc2bf0419d1.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge and skills of a fundamental level in food preparation. They have a basic understanding of food safety and sanitation and culinary nutrition.
0f1ed70b-ae65-4af2-a87f-9bc2bf0419d1.name: ACF Certified Fundamentals Cook® (CFC®)

badge_template_activities.title: No work experience required.
Must show the equivalent of a high school diploma or GED and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

f6468d83-caa1-4963-acdc-62aadc24ca90.description: Earners of this specialized certificate have demonstrated proficiency on the skills, knowledge and competencies for safely handling culinary cannabis and edibles.
f6468d83-caa1-4963-acdc-62aadc24ca90.name: Specialized Certificate in Culinary Cannabis and Edibles

badge_template_activities.title: Applicants must pass the online exam covering questions on plant anatomy, storing and cooking, concentrates and extracts, endocannabinoid system, terpenes, math and potency, safety.

e61f8382-5864-485e-9385-e09de39f6bfc.description: Postsecondary programs that have earned this badge have demonstrated their understanding of and compliance with the ACFEF-accredited standards. Earners have been evaluated in Program Eligibility, Program Mission and Goals, Organization and Administration, Faculty and Staff, Curriculum, Facilities, Student Services, Program Assessment. The ACFEF Accrediting Commission is recognized by the Council on Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA).
e61f8382-5864-485e-9385-e09de39f6bfc.name: ACFEF Postsecondary Accredited Program - Culinary Arts

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed an assessment-based program that meets the ACFEF Accreditation Standards and Required Knowledge and Skills Competencies in culinary arts.
Recognition is granted following a rigorous in-person evaluation verifying the required standards are met.

ba3be254-8e13-4b17-befd-1aa3a6c42804.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an intermediate level in pastry food preparation. They have a good understanding in food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition and supervisory management and prepare food to high standards.
ba3be254-8e13-4b17-befd-1aa3a6c42804.name: ACF Certified Working Pastry Chef® (CWPC®)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of two years of work experience supervising a shift or food station. Work history must be current within the last 10 years.

Must show equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts/Baking Pastry through a combination of education and work experience and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition and Supervisory Management.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

763398c6-7673-4a09-a48d-0243266384db.description: Earners of this certificate have demonstrated that they have a knowledge of a fundamental level in food preparation. They have a basic understanding of food safety and sanition and culinary nutrition.
763398c6-7673-4a09-a48d-0243266384db.name: Certificate of Culinary Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must pass an online exam covering basic food preparation, introduction to foodservice, food safety and sanitation and culinary nutrition.

1a8f8d3b-c42c-42b6-82db-e4f601441fea.description: Postsecondary programs that have earned this badge have demonstrated their understanding of and compliance with the ACFEF-accredited standards. 1a8f8d3b-c42c-42b6-82db-e4f601441fea.name: ACFEF Postsecondary Accredited Program - Baking and Pastry

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed an assessment-based program that meets the ACFEF Accreditation Standards and Required Knowledge and Skills Competencies in baking and pastry.
Recognition is granted following a rigorous in-person evaluation verifying the required standards are met.

3d16e6d7-e526-4005-a758-b7e1c1c895fb.name: ACFEF Postsecondary Accredited Program - Exemplary, Culinary Arts

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed an assessment-based program that meets the ACFEF Accreditation Standards and Required Knowledge and Skills Competencies in culinary arts.
Recognition is granted following a rigorous in-person evaluation verifying the required standards are met. Exemplary programs have been in full compliance for two grant periods.

966b4c4a-af20-4ad3-a64d-57014cbd1aa3.description: Earners of the ACFEF Certificate of Baking and Pastry Essentials have demonstrated knowledge in industry-standard competencies in the areas of baking and pastry fundamentals, food safety/sanitation, culinary nutrition and foodservice management. It aligns with ACF’s Certified Fundamental Pastry Cook certification.
966b4c4a-af20-4ad3-a64d-57014cbd1aa3.name: Certificate of Baking and Pastry Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must pass an online exam covering baking and pastry fundamentals, introduction to foodservice, food safety and sanitation and culinary nutrition.

973fb101-1a73-49bb-a6f9-81e12f93fb38.description: Secondary programs that have earned this badge have demonstrated their understanding of and compliance with the ACFEF-accredited standards. Earners have been evaluated in Program Eligibility, Program Mission and Goals, Organization and Administration, Faculty and Staff, Curriculum, Facilities, Student Services, Program Assessment. The ACFEF Accrediting Commission is recognized by the Council on Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA).
973fb101-1a73-49bb-a6f9-81e12f93fb38.name: ACFEF Secondary Accredited Program - Culinary Arts

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed an assessment-based program that meets the ACFEF Accreditation Standards and Required Knowledge and Skills Competencies in culinary arts.
Recognition is granted following a rigorous in-person evaluation verifying the required standards are met.

86b70766-ad11-4c8c-9243-fa281a7d2f0e.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an advanced level in food preparation. They are proficient in advanced food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition, human resource management, beverage management and cost control management and prepare food of the highest quality.
86b70766-ad11-4c8c-9243-fa281a7d2f0e.name: ACF Certified Master Chef® (CMC®)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of obtaining the Certified Executive Chef level of certification and be currently employed in a food service operation with supervisory responsibilities.

Must show the equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts through combination of education and work experience and completion of 30 hours each in Advanced Sanitation, Wine Service and Human Resources Management.

Successful completion of practical exam consisting of the following exam majors: freestyle, healthy cooking, global cuisine, baking and pastry, buffet catering, classical cuisine, European cuisine and market basket.

e66e6ca0-917f-4cea-ac2b-84a4e1ef4611.description: Secondary programs that have earned this badge have demonstrated their understanding of and compliance with the ACFEF-accredited standards. Earners have been evaluated in Program Eligibility, Program Mission and Goals, Organization and Administration, Faculty and Staff, Curriculum, Facilities, Student Services, Program Assessment. Exemplary programs have been in full compliance for two grant periods. ACFEF Accrediting Commission is recognized by the Council on Higher Education Accreditation.
e66e6ca0-917f-4cea-ac2b-84a4e1ef4611.name: ACFEF Secondary Accredited Program - Exemplary, Culinary Arts

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed an assessment-based program that meets the ACFEF Accreditation Standards and Required Knowledge and Skills Competencies in culinary arts.
Recognition is granted following a rigorous in-person evaluation verifying the required standards are met. Exemplary programs have been in full compliance for two grant periods.

273dda96-0320-44db-8387-872ee67f44fa.description: Earners of this badge participated in an advanced-level educational experience focusing on menu innovation, fine dining culinary trends, advanced cooking concepts and modern plating techniques.
273dda96-0320-44db-8387-872ee67f44fa.name: Specialized Certificate in Advanced Culinary Trends and Techniques

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete an online written assessment outlining the skills learned during the summit.

ff3dc296-6618-414f-bf67-3bc5e0a1fa2a.description: Earners of this badge participated in an advanced-level educational experience focusing on advanced bread baking and pastry trends and techniques.
ff3dc296-6618-414f-bf67-3bc5e0a1fa2a.name: Specialized Certificate in Advanced Pastry Trends and Techniques

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete an online written assessment outlining the skills learned during the summit.

Earners attended the following sessions: Modernist Cuisine: Pastry, Design & Art, presented by Francisco Migoya; Natural Food Colors, presented by Lasheeda Perry; Advanced Concepts in Bread-Baking: Pre-Ferments, presented by Lisa Kirschner; Demystifying Sugar Techniques, presented by Susan Notter, CEPC.

eb0dffa0-9883-485b-9a5d-b6970e6d9fe8.description: Postsecondary programs that have earned this badge have demonstrated their understanding of and compliance with the ACFEF-accredited standards. Earners have been evaluated in Program Eligibility, Program Mission and Goals, Organization and Administration, Faculty and Staff, Curriculum, Facilities, Student Services, Program Assessment. badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed an assessment-based program that meets the ACFEF Accreditation Standards and Required Knowledge and Skills Competencies in baking and pastry.

1d9e1202-5d5d-46f9-912b-086874461786.description: Apprenticeship programs that have earned this badge have demonstrated their understanding of and compliance with the ACFEF-apprenticeship standards. Earners have been evaluated in Program Eligibility, Program Mission and Goals, Organization and Administration, Educators and Curriculum, Facilities and Supervising Chefs. The ACFEF Apprenticeship Standards are approved and certified by the Department of Labor.
1d9e1202-5d5d-46f9-912b-086874461786.name: ACFEF Apprenticeship Program

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed an assessment-based program that meets the ACFEF Apprenticeship Standards and Required Knowledge and Skills Competencies.
Recognition is granted following a rigorous in-person evaluation verifying the required standards are met.

365cf047-1da6-4164-a51e-8eb289d7fddf.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge and skills of a fundamental level in pastry food preparation. They have a basic understanding of food safety and sanition and culinary nutrition.
365cf047-1da6-4164-a51e-8eb289d7fddf.name: ACF Certified Fundamentals Pastry Cook® (CFPC®)

badge_template_activities.title: No work experience required.
Must show the equivalent of a high school diploma or GED and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

cff1c126-854a-4df9-aabe-835ea52a4554.description: Organizations that have earned this badge have demonstrated their understanding of and compliance with the ACFEF-approved program requirements. Earners are culinary/hospitality-related and have been evaluated and meet the requirements for: Qualified Instructors, Defined Program Outcomes, Adequate Facilities.
cff1c126-854a-4df9-aabe-835ea52a4554.name: ACFEF Approved Program

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completed and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Recognition is granted following an in-person evaluation verifying the requirements are met. Initial recognition is granted for three years. Renewal recognition is five years.

52652ad7-81d6-4d49-a766-b118ab886b4a.description: Earners of this badge participated in advanced-level management sessions focusing on crisis management, restaurant/employment law, costing and purchasing best practices, as well as team wellness and mentorship.
52652ad7-81d6-4d49-a766-b118ab886b4a.name: Certificate of Culinary Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete an online written assessment outlining the skills learned during the sessions.

24adbf33-4ce1-4356-be2d-9adda890ee4c.description: Secondary programs that have earned this badge have demonstrated their understanding of and compliance with the ACFEF-accredited standards. 24adbf33-4ce1-4356-be2d-9adda890ee4c.name: ACFEF Secondary Accredited Program - Baking and Pastry

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed an assessment-based program that meets the ACFEF Accreditation Standards and Required Knowledge and Skills Competencies in baking and pastry.
Recognition is granted following a rigorous in-person evaluation verifying the required standards are met.

94f17da5-2025-4210-acaf-25da0be74f30.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an advanced level in food preparation. They are proficient in food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition and business management and prepare food of the highest quality.
94f17da5-2025-4210-acaf-25da0be74f30.name: ACF Personal Certified Executive Chef™ (PCEC™)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of three years of work experience as a personal chef engaged in all aspects of food preparation and management on a cook-for-hire basis. Work history must be current within the last 10 years.
Must show equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition and Business Management.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

f0bf4f89-e14d-49d6-8acc-d59fed6228e8.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an intermediate level in food preparation. They have a good understanding in food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition and business management and prepare food to high standards.
f0bf4f89-e14d-49d6-8acc-d59fed6228e8.name: ACF Personal Certified Chef™ (PCC™)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of three years entry level work experience and one year working full-time as a personal chef engaged in the preparation, cooking, serving and sorting of foods on a cook-for-hire basis. Work history must be current within the last 10 years.
Must show equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts and completion of 30 hours each in Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition and Business Management.
Successful completion of written exam to evaluate culinary knowledge AND practical exam to assess skill proficiency.

e08278e5-1b71-4e8b-8485-7ba0629dba61.description: Earners of the Specialized Certificate for Personal Chefs have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge required of personal chefs. They have a good understanding in safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition, food preparation and personal chef management concepts.
e08278e5-1b71-4e8b-8485-7ba0629dba61.name: Specialized Certificate: Personal Chefs

badge_template_activities.title: Applicants must pass an online exam covering safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition, food preparation and personal chef management concepts

000880a9-8a0b-492e-9d3b-12c8b5532423.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated they have reached a benchmark of knowledge, skills and culinary experience of an advanced level in pastry food preparation. They are proficient in advanced food safety and sanitation, culinary nutrition, human resource management, beverage management and cost control management and prepare food of the highest quality.
000880a9-8a0b-492e-9d3b-12c8b5532423.name: ACF Certified Master Pastry Chef® (CMPC®)

badge_template_activities.title: Minimum of obtaining the Certified Executive Pastry Chef level of certification and be currently employed in a food service operation with supervisory responsibilities.

Must show the equivalent of an Associate's degree in Culinary Arts/Baking Pastry through combination of education and work experience and completion of 30 hours each in Advanced Sanitation, Wine Service and Human Resources Management.

Successful completion of practical exam consisting of the following exam majors: Healthy Baking and Pastry, Artistic Baking, Freestyle, Classical Tortes, Plated Desserts and Pastry Arts Buffet, Chocolates and Petit Fours with Centerpiece, International Pastries, Grand Buffet

1251683e-9307-4851-80bf-cb630544dab4.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated their understanding of and compliance with the standards for ACFEF approved culinary medicine kitchens. Earners have been evaluated in employing qualified, trained staff, using minimal processed foods, verifying origin of ingredients, using healthful food techniques, following truth in menu.
1251683e-9307-4851-80bf-cb630544dab4.name: ACFEF Approved Culinary Medicine Kitchen

e68baaaa-6f34-4973-9d71-cc3b03aac8c2.name: ACFEF Secondary Accredited Program - Exemplary, Foodservice

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed an assessment-based program that meets the ACFEF Accreditation Standards and Required Knowledge and Skills Competencies in foodservice management.
Recognition is granted following a rigorous in-person evaluation verifying the required standards are met. Exemplary programs have been in full compliance for two grant periods.

76109539-5336-4602-8a56-ca98924b2fd5.description: Secondary programs that have earned this badge have demonstrated their understanding of and compliance with the ACFEF-accredited standards. Earners have been evaluated in Program Eligibility, Program Mission and Goals, Organization and Administration, Faculty and Staff, Curriculum, Facilities, Student Services, Program Assessment. The ACFEF Accrediting Commission is recognized by the Council on Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA).
76109539-5336-4602-8a56-ca98924b2fd5.name: ACFEF Secondary Accredited Program - Foodservice Management

badge_template_activities.title: Organization completes and submits an application with supporting evidence.
Organization has developed an assessment-based program that meets the ACFEF Accreditation Standards and Required Knowledge and Skills Competencies in foodservice management.
Recognition is granted following a rigorous in-person evaluation verifying the required standards are met.
